data.stimulus: To build a cohesive argument, you need THREE elements...
data.template:
1. Your main point / idea / opinion - this is the {{response}}
  2. Why you believe your claim is true - this is the {{response}}
  3. The research that proves your claim is true - this is the {{response}}

value: A team where people of different cultures work together.
A team where people of different nationalities work together.
Thinking differently, creatively, or from a new perspective.
Part of a job which involves administrative work and keeping records.
A place where people work, such as an office or factory.

possible_responses: A team where people of different nationalities work together.
Part of a job which involves administrative work and keeping records.
A team where people of different cultures work together.
A place where people work, such as an office or factory.
Thinking differently, creatively, or from a new perspective.
data.stimulus:
Over the next exercises, you are going to examine how cohesive the following arguments are.

 

â–º Remember: a cohesive argument means that all elements are united, support each other and work well together.

 

 

Before you start, let's focus on two key words and concepts.

Match the words with the definitions.

value: A team where people of different cultures work together.
A team where people of different nationalities work together.
Thinking differently, creatively, or from a new perspective.
Part of a job which involves administrative work and keeping records.
A place where people work, such as an office or factory.

data.stimulus:
Read Argument 1 below.

â–º Identify the claim, the reason and the evidence.
data.template: A multicultural workforce can help your company expand into geographic and demographic areas that might otherwise be unfamiliar to your firm ({{response}}). Workers from other cultures usually have a good knowledge of the foods people enjoy, the music they listen to, even the styles and colours of clothing they find most acceptable ({{response}}). Mason (2018) argues that this knowledge that can be put to effective use in marketing your products to new groups of consumers ({{response}}).

options.label: The claim is not related to the reason
The reason doesnâ€™t provide support or explanation

data.stimulus:
Read Argument 2 below.

In my opinion, In my opinion, managing staff from other cultures or other countries presents a lot of challenges because they often don't understand each other. 

This argument is not cohesive.

â–º What is the problem?

options.label: The reason doesnâ€™t provide support or explanation
The evidence just repeats the reason
The claim is not related to the reason

data.stimulus:
Read Argument 3 below.

Managing staff from other cultures or other countries presents a lot of challenges because it's quite difficult. According to Smith (2015) there are several drawbacks in multinational teams.

This argument is not cohesive.

â–º What is the problem? (Choose TWO)

options.label: The reason doesnâ€™t provide support or explanation
The reason doesnâ€™t provide support or explanation
The evidence is not related to the reason

data.stimulus:
Read Argument 4 below.

Managing staff from other cultures or other countries presents a lot of challenges. This can happen if team members come from cultures which have different styles of collaboration. In his article, Murthy (2017) notes that while U.S. and European cultures have different aspects, they also share many common traits.

This argument is not cohesive.

â–º What is the problem?

value: because of their different personal backgrounds, education and previous work experience.
Research conducted by Oxford University (2019) shows that members of multinational teams tend to make faster progress in their careers.
by learning about other cultures, and how to interact across cultural barriers.
According to the Financial Times (2019), multinational teams are likely to have significant advantages when you need out-of-the-box thinking for a project.
because different cultures may have very different styles of collaboration.
For example, the Harvard Business Review (2017) claims that U.S. culture emphases on individual thought and action while other cultures may favour consensus.

possible_responses: because of their different personal backgrounds, education and previous work experience.
by learning about other cultures, and how to interact across cultural barriers.
because different cultures may have very different styles of collaboration.
Research conducted by Oxford University (2019) shows that members of multinational teams tend to make faster progress in their careers.
According to the Financial Times (2019), multinational teams are likely to have significant advantages when you need out-of-the-box thinking for a project.
For example, the Harvard Business Review (2017) claims that U.S. culture emphases on individual thought and action while other cultures may favour consensus.
data.stimulus:
The next activities focus on argument structure.

â–º Read the options below carefully. For each CLAIM, select a REASON and EVIDENCE.

 

â–º Remember: all  elements must support each other and work well together.
data.template:
Claim

Reason

Evidence

People from different cultures often see the world in different ways

{{response}} {{response}}

If a multicultural team is well managed, all employees tend to benefit

{{response}} {{response}}

Teamwork in multinational teams requires significantly more effort,

{{response}} {{response}}

value: because of their different personal backgrounds, education and previous work experience.
Research conducted by Oxford University (2019) shows that members of multinational teams tend to make faster progress in their careers.
by learning about other cultures, and how to interact across cultural barriers.
According to the Financial Times (2019), multinational teams are likely to have significant advantages when you need out-of-the-box thinking for a project.
because different cultures may have very different styles of collaboration.
For example, the Harvard Business Review (2017) claims that U.S. culture emphases on individual thought and action while other cultures may favour consensus.

data.stimulus:
Consider the sentences below from the previous exercise.

â–º Choose the option from the drop down that uses cautious language
data.template:
1. There {{response}} practical difficulties in managing people from different countries.. 
  2. {{response}} that managers from different cultures have the same management styles.
  3. There are {{response}} challenges in managing a multicultural team.
  4. Customers {{response}} from having a multinational sales team.
  5.  Several business leaders agree that multinational teams {{response}} an advantage.
  6. Multicultural teams {{response}} a positive effect on staff motivation.
